meanings.sent1: The trifacial shape of the prism made it unique.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a trifacial sculpture with three distinct sides.
meanings.sent3: The trifacial cake had three different flavors in each layer.
meanings.sent4: Her trifacial personality showed different sides in different situations.
meanings.sent5: The trifacial mountain stood out with its three distinct peaks.

meanings.definition: Affecting or involving three facial nerves.
meanings.sent1: The trifacial condition caused numbness in three areas of the face.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with a trifacial nerve disorder.
meanings.sent3: His trifacial twitch made his expressions look funny.
meanings.sent4: The trifacial pain felt like sharp jolts on three parts of her face.
meanings.sent5: The trifacial nerve damage affected her ability to smile, blink, and chew.

meanings.definition: Affecting or involving three facial bones.
meanings.sent1: The trifacial fracture required surgery to repair three bones.
meanings.sent2: The X-ray showed a trifacial injury involving the cheekbone, jaw, and eye socket.
meanings.sent3: The trifacial break made his face look crooked.
meanings.sent4: Her trifacial bone structure was unique and required special care.
meanings.sent5: The trifacial bone density scan revealed issues in three facial areas.
